result.execSummary:
The defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges and assessments.  To be paid by 10/24/2016.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. stats to apply for work.  Court is opposed to electronic monitoring.  Court is not opposed to defendant being released to the Day Reporting Center.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor; further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roy Rejalio Rodriguez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Denying Reuqest to Amend Judgment of Conviction received and filed.  Copies mailed to defendant andthe State./ds
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for GPS/electronic monitoring.

records.descr: Request to correct error in court records

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO CORRECT ERROR IN COURT RECORDS. FILED BY ATTY. SUSAN C. LUND. kl

Defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

SENTENCING HEARING CONTINUED.
Court spoke with defendant's agent, and was given a letter, in which parties discussed.  
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work.  Court is OPPOSED TO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.  COURT IS NOT OPPOSED to defendant being released to the day reporting center.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 10/24/2016.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court wants to speak with defendant's agent.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 4/23/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 3.
As to count 1:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
As to count 2: Court ordered count dismissed and read in for sentencing.
Case is adjourned to 4-21-2015 at 8:30 am for Sentencing in Branch 3.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Case scheduled for final pretrial.  Defendant has just been released from custody, and requests time to review case.  State may revise offer.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 2/17/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court orders all final pretrial documents filed by the next court date.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, and no dangerous weapons or firearms.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Attorney Joseph R Kennedy in court, defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 1/12/2015 at 8:30 am, and for jury trial on 3/4/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph R Kennedy in court, defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Defense counsel requests time to go over discovery with client.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 10/16/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date. aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defense counsel requests an adjournment of scheduling conference set for 10/3/2014.  Case adjouned for scheduling conference on 10/2/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw

XXX Public Defender Appointment

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 04-08-2014 received and filed. (19 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Joseph Kennedy, 309 N Water St, Ste 350, Milwaukee, WI 53202.

Attorney Joseph R Kennedy in court, defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Kennedy was just appointed in this case.  Notice of retainer received and filed.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 10/3/2014 at 9:00 am, branch 3.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez in court with attorney Laurence M. Moon.  Defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Moon informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney Moon is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel to 9/4/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Status conference scheduled for September 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's motions in limine, received and filed.  aw
Motion to withdraw as counsel, received and filed.  aw
State's motion in limine, received and filed.  aw
State's proposed jury instructions received and filed.  aw
State's Witness List, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez in court with attorney Laurence M Moon.  Defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Milwaukee Police Officer, Tyler Kirkvold.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Court held colloquy with defendant on his right to testify and right not to testify.  Defense rests.  Closing arguments made.  Court denies defense motion to suppress for reasons stated on the record.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 8/25/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's response to the defendant's motion to suppress evidence, received and filed.  aw
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE FACILITY FOR PURPOSES OF THE MOTION HEARING / FINAL PRETRIAL / JURY TRIAL IN BRANCH 3.

Attorney Laurence M Moon in court, Defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the Criminal Justice Facility for purposes of this hearing. Case adjourned for a Motion / Final Pretrial / Jury Trial in Branch 3.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Laurence M. Moon in court, defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel wants to file a motion.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 4/21/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Defense also requested a speedy trial demand.  Defendant has a VOP hold and is not entitled to a speed demand.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez in court with attorney Laurence M. Moon.  Defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez in custody.  Kevin Shomin for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Tyler Kirkvold-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez in court with attorney Laurence M. Moon.  Defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State is requesting an adjournment, officer is not available for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Roy Rejalio Rodriguez in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Court entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2 preserving Defendant's right to substitution.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.


**STATE TO ADDRESS BAIL ON THE NEXT DATE.**
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
